text: Hi everyone, one of our clients wants to migrate their 10,000 pages WordPress website to HubSpot CMS. This includes 2,500 product pages with a category taxonomy (not an ecommerce, just unstructured content describing the products + CTAs, currently no prices and no stock is displayed). What would be the best approach to tackle this? can we somehow create "custom product objects" like we would do in WordPress? Do we create one page per product or "master pages" that are dynamically populated using HubDB and modules?  How do we create an "advanced search" module that allows us to filter by keywords/cetegories/tags?  <@U22PKFRU5>

I'd do dynamic pages if it were me. The only modifier to that would be if there are variations in the types of content needed on those pages. If they're majority the same HubDB dynamic pages are the way to go.

Sounds like a fun project!
Out of curiosity, is there a desire to also use the "Products" CRM object for these products, so they can use them in Deals, and the CRM?
it would be a nice to have, however knowing that you cant extend properties for the product object i dont know how far we can get with that
The client currently has Marketing+Sales+CMS Professional
How would you manage the content? is there a way to create a customized back end for these "objects" like in WordPress?
No, this informations in a tabular format when using hubDB
